alert.note: Alert for East Carteret; Pamlico; Southern Craven; West Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Craven, central Carteret and south central Pamlico Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Harlowe, or near Havelock, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havelock, Morehead City, South River, North River, Merrimon, Straits, Smyrna, Harlowe, Otway, Great Neck, Open Grounds Farm, North Harlowe, Bettie, Cherry Branch Ferry Terminal, Minnesott Beach Ferry and Gloucester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Carteret; Pamlico; Southern Craven; West Carteret
